content.statement: vascular:renal:renal-002-atherosclerotic-ras is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Renal-Artery that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:renal:renal-002-atherosclerotic-ras helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:renal:renal-002-atherosclerotic-ras include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:renal:renal-002-atherosclerotic-ras.

epidemiology.prevalence: 7% of patients >65 years on autopsy studies
epidemiology.risk_factors: Hypertension, diabetes, smoking, hyperlipidemia, PAD, coronary disease
epidemiology.natural_history: 16-18% progress to complete occlusion over 5 years

renovascular_hypertension.features: Resistant hypertension, sudden onset, or worsening in elderly
renovascular_hypertension.clues: Abdominal bruit, hypokalemia, creatinine rise with ACEi

ischemic_nephropathy.features: Progressive renal insufficiency with bilateral or solitary kidney stenosis

flash_pulmonary_edema.features: Recurrent sudden pulmonary edema with preserved EF
flash_pulmonary_edema.clues: Often bilateral RAS, responds dramatically to revascularization

unstable_angina.mechanism: Sodium retention and volume expansion from RAAS activation

diagnosis.duplex_ultrasound: PSV >200 cm/s, RAR >3.5, loss of early systolic peak
diagnosis.CTA: Anatomic visualization, assess aorta and renal parenchyma

medical_therapy.statins: Reduce cardiovascular events, may slow progression
medical_therapy.monitoring: Serial creatinine, kidney size, blood pressure

revascularization.stenting: Primary approach, self-expanding or balloon-expandable stents
revascularization.surgical: Aortorenal bypass reserved for failed stenting or complex anatomy

definition.@value: Stenosis of the renal artery due to atherosclerotic plaque, typically at the ostium, causing renovascular hypertension and potentially ischemic nephropathy.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the pathophysiology of atherosclerotic RAS
Identify clinical syndromes suggesting renovascular disease
Understand the CORAL trial findings and their implications
Select patients who may benefit from revascularization
clinical_pearls: ARAS is 90% of renovascular disease - FMD is only 10%
CORAL trial showed NO benefit of stenting for most patients - medical therapy first
Flash pulmonary edema is the STRONGEST indication for revascularization
Creatinine rise >30% with ACEi suggests bilateral RAS or solitary kidney stenosis
Lesions are typically OSTIAL - within 5mm of aorta
Duplex criteria: PSV >200 cm/s, renal:aortic ratio >3.5
